intro: Chesneya rytidosperma, commonly known as the desert chesney, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems that store water, allowing it to survive in dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are typically reduced to small, scale-like structures, minimizing water loss through transpiration. Chesneya rytidosperma is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils.
